intro: Calendula asterias, commonly known as the common marigold, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to southern Europe and western Asia and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange petals and dark brown central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calendula asterias is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
